about:
My name is Andrew Gentile and I am a full-stack software developer. My computing career began in support, working my way through various roles ranging from help desk to enterprise telephony. I studied audio technology at Middle Tennessee State University, where I took my first programming classes and fell in love with programming. Being highly motivated and a quick study, I transitioned into a full time developer role in 2018.

I come from a musical family and began playing guitar at age five. By 13, I was playing out professionally three nights a week at venues across south Florida. Throughout high school, I played with the jazz band and received a scholarship to study jazz guitar at MTSU. In 2016, I co-founded a recording studio, from which artists went on to work with major independent labels. Music is truly a part of my DNA and I am constantly working to bridge the gap between music and technology.
